doc.field:
This layer contains the rough boundaries of the sewersheds for the Twin Cities metropolitan area. A sewershed is a defined area that is tributary to a single point along an MCES interceptor pipe (a community connection to an interceptor) or is tributary to a single lift station. Community boundaries are also used to define sewer-shed boundaries.
The data are derived from community comprehensive sewer plans.
Notes: - The sewersheds are estimated. The actual sewersheds may be different. - Not all records contain county or MCD information.

A sewershed is a defined area that is tributary to a single point along an MCES interceptor pipe (a community connection to an interceptor) or is tributary to a single lift station. Community boundaries are also used to define sewer-shed boundaries.
The data are derived from community comprehensive sewer plans.
Notes: - The sewersheds are estimated. The actual sewersheds may be different. - Not all records contain county or MCD information.</abstract><purpose>To provide more manageable areas for flow analysis and planning and to distinguish between the sewered and unsewered areas within the Metropolitan Urban Service Area (MUSA).</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20120601</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>Sewershed polygon data is based on most recent local sanitary system available to MCES, and MCES interceptors.</current></timeperd><status><progress>In work</progress><update>As Needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-94.012</westbc><eastbc>-92.732</eastbc><northbc>45.415</northbc><southbc>44.471</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>None</themekt><themekey>sewershed, utilities sewer sewage sewerage waste water</themekey></theme><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>None</useconst><browse><browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/Sewersheds.jpg</browsen><browsed>Sample map showing the sewersheds layer.</browsed></browse><native>ArcGIS 9x</native><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Tim Leach</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>Environmental Services Division</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>Minnesota</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651-602-1063</cntvoice><cntfax>651-602-1030</cntfax><cntemail>tim.leach@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><dataqual><logic>The dataset is topologically 'clean'.</logic><complete>Entire seven county geographic area is covered.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>The positional accuracy of the dataset has not been tested under the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy. The positional accuracy of the dataset is UNKNOWN.</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><srcinfo><srcscale /></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>The dataset includes information from comprehensive plans submitted as of March 18th, 1997.
The dataset is derived from community comprehensive sewer plans and is referenced to the MnDOT (1992) street base.
The dataset is updated as new comprehensive plans are submitted to the Council.
The sewersheds are estimated. The actual sewersheds may be different.</procdesc></procstep><procstep><procdesc Sync="TRUE">Dataset copied.</procdesc><srcused Sync="TRUE">L:\Metadata\Layers\sewersheds_a</srcused><date Sync="TRUE">20090109</date><time Sync="TRUE">14315900</time></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><indspref>None</indspref><direct>Vector</direct><mgmg3obj>arcs, nodes, polygons, label points</mgmg3obj><mgmg3til>One layer for entire seven county region.</mgmg3til></spdoinfo><spref><vertdef><altsys><altdatum>Not applicable</altdatum><altunits /></altsys><depthsys><depthdn>Not applicable</depthdn><depthdu /></depthsys></vertdef><horizsys><planar><gridsys><gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn><utm><utmzone>15</utmzone></utm></gridsys><planci><plandu>meters</plandu></planci></planar><geodetic><horizdn>NAD83</horizdn><ellips>GRS80</ellips></geodetic></horizsys></spref><eainfo><overview><eaover>Polygon Attributes are:
Unique_ID: Tributary connection point on MCES interceptor (relational to InterceptorPoints)
Local_LS: Populated when shed is tributary to local lift station.
SewerState: 0= will not be served, 1= currently served, 2= potentially served.
CTU_ID: Numeric city identifier.
CTU_NAME: Text city identifier.
ID_NO: Text interceptor identifier to which the shed is tributary.
INTERCEPT: Numeric interceptor identifier to which the shed is tributary.
METER: Meter to which shed is a tributary
WWTP: Treatment plant to which shed is a tributary
SERVED: U = Unmetered, N = Not Served
FLOWS_TO: Community serving an Unmetered shed.
ADJUSTED: Is the Unmetered shed used in-house to adjust billing?
IC_AGREEMENT: Hyperlink address of intercommunity agreement for unmetered flow. </eaover><eadetcit>None</eadetcit></overview></eainfo><distinfo><resdesc>Sewersheds</resdesc><distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/.
